text: Mozesh "Mozzi" Gyorio (; born August 1, 1989) is a Canadian soccer player. ==Early life== His parents were born in Gunaroš in today's Vojvodina, Serbia. His family moved from Yugoslavia to Hungary when he was two years old. Two years later, the family moved to Canada. He speaks English, Hungarian, French, Serbian and Croatian. ==Career== ===Youth and College=== Gyorio moved to Canada with his parents when he was a small child, settling in Stratford, Prince Edward Island. He attended Charlottetown Rural High School, played for Sherwood Parkdale Rangers FC and Stratford Foxes FC,Charlottetown, The Guardian: Sports | P.E.I. senior men's soccer and spent time with the youth academy of famed Dutch club NEC Nijmegen in 2007Gyorio Selected for U20 National Team before returning to North America to continue his education. He subsequently played two years college soccer at San Jacinto College, where he was a NJCAA All-American honorable mention, was selected to the NJCAA all- region team and NSCAA all-region 2nd team, and was the college's offensive MVP in his senior year. He also spent time with Major League Soccer side Houston Dynamo's academy, and played for the team in the Dallas Cup in 2009. During his college years Gyorio also played with the Canadian amateur side Avondale Islanders in the Nova Scotia Soccer League. ===Professional=== Gyorio signed his first professional contract in 2010 when he was signed by FC Tampa Bay Rowdies in the USSF Division 2 Professional League.FC Tampa Bay Rowdies announce additional players for the 2010 roster He made his professional debut on May 1, 2010, as a substitute for Takuya Yamada in a game against Miami FC,http://ussf.demosphere.com/stats/2010/1634165.html and scored his first professional goals on October 1, 2010 in a 6–3 victory over Crystal Palace Baltimore.http://ussf.demosphere.com/stats/2010/1634317.html On November 30, 2010, Tampa Bay announced that it would exercise its contract option on Gyorio for the 2011 season.http://www.oursportscentral.com/services/releases/?id=4141291 Tampa Bay announced on December 27, 2011 that it would decline the 2012 contract option on Gyorio.http://www.nasl.com/index.php?id=3&newsid;=1610 In February 2012, he has joined an MLS side Sporting Kansas City as a trialist in their pre-season training camp for 2012 Major League Soccer season.http://www.sportingkc.com/news/2012/02/tale-two-halves-sporting-kc- draw-against-impact On January 1, 2013 Gyorio signed a 6-month deal with English League Two side Fleetwood Town.https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20882426 He made his European debut on February 12 against Oxford United at Kassam Stadium coming on as a substitute for David Ball.https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21332957 It was announced on the 7th of May 2013, that Fleetwood would not be offering the midfielder a new contract, and would therefore be released. On February 2, 2016 Gyorio made his return to Canada, signing with Ottawa Fury FC. In December 2016, the Fury announced that Gyorio would not return to the team as the club moved to USL in 2017. In September 2017, Gyorio signed with Italian Eccellenza club U.S.D. Pistunina (an amateur team in the city Messina, Sicily), but he played few games with the team between international transfer papers and in the middle of November he left to go back in Canada for family reasons. ==International career== Gyorio represented Canada at the 2009 Francophone Games in Lebanonhttp://www.albertasoccer.com/index.php?src=gendocs&ref;=JohnPeggArticleFrancophoneTeam&category;=Technical and was a member of the Canadian national U-20 pool. ==References== Category:1987 births Category:Living people Category:Association football midfielders Category:Canadian soccer players Category:Soccer people from Prince Edward Island Category:People from Bačka Topola Category:People from Queens County, Prince Edward Island Category:Hungarians in Vojvodina Category:Yugoslav emigrants to Canada Category:Yugoslav people of Hungarian descent Category:Canadian people of Hungarian descent Category:Naturalized citizens of Canada Category:Canadian expatriate soccer players Category:Expatriate footballers in the Netherlands Category:Canadian expatriate sportspeople in the Netherlands Category:Expatriate soccer players in the United States Category:Canadian expatriate sportspeople in the United States Category:Expatriate footballers in England Category:Canadian expatriate sportspeople in England Category:Expatriate footballers in Italy Category:Canadian expatriate sportspeople in Italy Category:NEC Nijmegen players Category:San Jacinto College alumni Category:Houston Dynamo players Category:Tampa Bay Rowdies players Category:Fleetwood Town F.C. players Category:Minnesota United FC (2010–2016) players Category:Austin Aztex players Category:Ottawa Fury FC players Category:USSF Division 2 Professional League players Category:North American Soccer League players Category:English Football League players Category:USL Championship players Category:Eccellenza players Category:Canada men's youth international soccer players
title: Mozzi Gyorio
